Content:: Gampaha electoral district is one of the 22 multi-member electoral districts of Sri Lanka created by the 1978 Constitution of Sri Lanka. The district is conterminous with the administrative district of Gampaha in the Western province. The district currently elects 18 of the 225 members of the Sri Lankan Parliament and had 1,785,964 registered electors in 2020.[2] Results of the 1st presidential election held on 20 October 1982 for the district:[3] Results of the 2nd presidential election held on 19 December 1988 for the district:[4] Results of the 3rd presidential election held on 9 November 1994 for the district:[5] Results of the 4th presidential election held on 21 December 1999 for the district:[6] Results of the 5th presidential election held on 17 November 2005 for the district:[7] Results of the 6th presidential election held on 26 January 2010 for the district:[8] Results of the 7th presidential election held on 8 January 2015:[9] Results of the 9th parliamentary election held on 15 February 1989 for the district:[10] Results of the 10th parliamentary election held on 16 August 1994 for the district:[11] Results of the 11th parliamentary election held on 10 October 2000 for the district:[12] Results of the 12th parliamentary election held on 5 December 2001 for the district:[14][15] Results of the 13th parliamentary election held on 2 April 2004 for the district:[17] Results of the 14th parliamentary election held on 8 April 2010 for the district:[26] Results of the 1st Western provincial council election held on 2 June 1988 for the district:[28] Results of the 2nd Western provincial council election held on 17 May 1993 for the district:[29] Results of the 3rd Western provincial council election held on 6 April 1999 for the district:[30][31] Results of the 4th Western provincial council election held on 10 July 2004 for the district: The following candidates were elected:[32] R.A.
